question.body: Which protein molecule is attached to iron molecules so it can be recycled and moved in the bloodstream?

response.feedback: Correct. Transferrin is an iron-binding transport protein in the bloodstream so new hemoglobin can be produced by red blood cells developing in the bone marrow.
Incorrect. Ferritin is an iron-binding protein, but it stores iron in tissues and cells, not circulating in the blood.
Incorrect. Hemosiderin is an iron-binding protein, but it stores iron in tissues and cells, not circulating in the blood.
Incorrect. Iron is a structural part of the hemoglobin molecule for oxygen transport, but hemoglobin is not "transporting" the iron to other tissues through the blood.

part.hint: Iron serves several vital functions and is vital for survival.
